paper_abstract: We consider a single-machine scheduling problem with periodic maintenance activities. Although the scheduling problem with maintenance has attracted researchers' attention, most of past studies considered only one maintenance period. In this research several maintenance periods are considered where each maintenance activity is scheduled after a periodic time interval. The objective is to find a schedule that minimizes the makespan, subject to periodic maintenance and nonresumable jobs. We first prove that the worst-case ratio of the classical LPT algorithm is 2. Then we show that there is no polynomial time approximation algorithm with a worst-case ratio less than 2 unless P = NP, which implies that the LPT algorithm is the best possible. paper_title: Single-machine scheduling with periodic maintenance to minimize makespan
